title: Search engine changing
content: I have a Windows server (Active directory with lot users) I want to change Search engine in Firefox for all users.
creator: unknownartist2077

title: Problem with Firefox on macOS 14.0
content:
Google Calendar has not worked right on Firefox (version 118.0.1 (64-bit)) on macOS since I updated to macOS 14.0. For example, when I try to use the "Search" function, I can't type a search string. Or sometimes when I create an event I have problems typing in the event title field as well. On these occasions when it doesn't work there is no blinking cursor placed at the left end of the text field, so you can't type in that field.

Hoping that this isn't just me, since I really like using FIrefox. Have had to move to the Edge Browser because Google Calendar is a central tool for me that has to work without having to fiddle around.
creator: MrDoh

title: Forced "Restart Firefox" message without an actual update
content:
Hi,

I use Firefox for it's "multi-account container" functionality for work, it's easy to work in parallel in multiple environments without needing multiple browser sessions (like with e.g. Chrome).

Recently, Firefox has been prompting me with a "An update to Firefox started in the background. You'll need to restart to finish the update." message.

Yes, in general this forced update is annoying, but this is not about that.

  • When I proceed with the restart, I get a "You've launched an older version of Firefox" error message. Causing me to lose all my data when I press "create a new profile".
  • A day or two after going through the hassle of setting everything back up, I get the message again.
  • this time I check in settings and see "Firefox is up to date", "Version 118.0.1 (64-bit)".
  • I check on the Firefox website (using a different browser), and confirm this is the latest version -> Issue 1
  • I open Firefox, same "You've launched an older version of Firefox" error -> Issue 2
  • I worked around this by downloading the latest beta "Version 119.0b5 (64-bit)", which allows me to open the browser and recover my work
  • all of this happened while I have the updates toggle on "Check for updates but let you choose to install them" -> Issue 3


Problems:

  1. Issue 1: faulty update notice.
  2. Issue 2: because of faulty update, I'd lose my data
  3. Issue 3: Firefox shouldn't have updated in the first place, as auto-updates are off and I didn't accept any update message

! I'm on a MacBook Pro 2023 (M2 Pro Apple Silicon). ! I wrote this after the update to beta, so system information is not as it was at time of problem ! Please allow for a preview before submitting a support ticket

Can you please sort this out, I'd love to keep using your tool but this (together with the premise of instant forced restarts in a corporate environment) is making it very hard for us to love your browser.
creator: bsamyn

title: Exporting (not copying) a digital certificate
content:
I wish to export, and not copy, a digital certificate so that I can import it to Keychain on my Mac. The only option in Firefox Browser on Mac is to copy, which means it only opens as a TextEdit and cannot be imported.

Any recommendations?
creator: adrianpadina

title: Theme Changes Some Components to Dark-mode Despite Override
content:
Hiya,

I use a theme which some years ago (after a change in the way Firefox handles dark-mode preferences) changed all UI and websites to use dark-mode. I was able to keep using the theme, and mostly override this behavior by setting:

`layout.css.prefers-color-scheme.content-override = 1`

However, this didn't take for some components, such as the sidebar and bookmark editor window, which still continue to use dark-mode.

Is there any way to completely disable dark-mode everywhere, and still use my preferred theme?

Cheers, Afraz
creator: afrazkhan

title: Unable to connect to the web on Firefox
content: I am running Firefox 118.0.1 for ARM MacOS, and every site I visit does not work. Instead, I get an "Unable to connect" message, and Firefox is reporting it failed to check for updates. As Firefox worked before running "brew install stats", I suspect that has something to do with it, but I have tried turning my firewall to automatically allow built-in software to receive internet connections, and even tried quitting Firefox. I strongly suspect it is the Stats brew I installed, as browsers normally don't break a week after an update was installed, but quitting Stats doesn't help.
creator: ethan.a.glasby

title: Pages within some websites won't load using Firefox only
content: Statement won't load a 2nd time on credit card site. Stays blank then turns entire computer screen black. Can't open member page at Blue Cross Blue Shield. These work on Edge. Just not on Firefox. Have done all troubleshooting options. Nothing is working. I need your support.

title: Why is firefox exe running on my GPU ?!!!?
content: WHY IS FIREFOX EXE RUNNING ON MY GPU  ? -- Task manager (Win10x64 22H2) 'processes' shows 7 firefoxes running (task manager 'details' shows 15! with only 3 tabs open); nVidia GPU Activity shows 2 running on my GPU, I don't know whether these are included in these counts or are extra to them. To forestall (hopefully) buck-passing evasions: I'm running an comparativerly old but still working fine 4th gen 4-core (8 threads) i7 cpu with 16 GB RAM, so there should be no reason to HAVE TO tap into the 16GB VRAM. ///WHY/// is firefox running on my GPU at all ?!!???? why so many firefoxes?, why the discrepancy between 'processes' and 'details' ?
creator: xprmt0017a4

title: Strange characters appearing in my bank credit card statements on my desktop, but not on my laptop
content:
When downloading my bank credit card statements on my desktop (but not on my laptop), all the numbers appear in strange characters like hieroglyphics.This also happened about 4-5 weeks ago then corrected. I talked to my bank and after looking at the problem, said it must be a problem with the browser, as it doesn't happen on my laptop or on their review of the statements.


Below is a screenshot example.
creator: hqpl
